page.title: 13EDUCATION
page.content: Our village school is in School Crescent, Corse. There are 89 children and 5 teachers. Mr Evans is the Headmaster and Mrs Williams is the Deputy Head. There are 4 classrooms. The Infant room was built in 1871 and the other classrooms are in Terrapin buildings which were built in 1972 when Staunton Schol closed and 34 from Staunton to Corse. Children come to our school when they are 4 and leave at 11. Most children then go to Newent Comprehensive School. We do all the usual lessons like Maths, English, Scripture, History, Geography, Science and Games. Boys play football and cricket and the girls play rounders and netball. We go to camp for a week in summer and we go to interesting places. At Christmas we do a concert in the village hall.
